abi.name: ABI MCP Client
abi.error: Tools are dynamically generated from a user-provided contract ABI

tools.name: ATP_AGENT_STATS
tools.description: Get statistics and details of a given AI agent on the ATP platform.

tokenContract.description: The contract address of the agent token (e.g., 0x123...abc).

tools.name: ATP_GET_AGENTS
tools.description: Retrieve a list of AI agents from the ATP platform with optional sorting and limiting.

sort.description:
Sort agents by market cap, holders count, or inference count.
        Available options are:
        - mcap: Sort by market cap
        - holders: Sort by holders count
        - inferences: Sort by inference count
        Defaults to market cap if not specified.

tools.name: ATP_GET_AGENT_LOGS
tools.description: Retrieve logs for a specific AI agent, with pagination.

agentTokenContract.description: The contract address of the agent token.

page.description: Page number for pagination. Defaults to 1.

limit.description: Number of logs per page. Defaults to 10.

tools.name: ATP_ADD_AGENT_LOG
tools.description: Add a new log entry for a specific AI agent. Requires API key as a parameter.

agentTokenContract.description: The contract address of the agent token.

content.description: The content of the log message.

txHash.description: Optional transaction hash associated with this log entry.

chainId.description: Optional chain ID associated with this log entry.

tools.name: ATP_BUY_AGENT
tools.description: Buy AI agent tokens using IQ as the base currency.

tokenContract.description: The contract address of the agent token to buy.

amount.description: The amount of base currency (IQ) to spend for buying the agent token, specified in wei units (e.g., '1000000000000000000' for 1 IQ).

tools.name: ATP_SELL_AGENT
tools.description: Sell AI agent tokens back to the protocol.

tokenContract.description: The contract address of the agent token to sell.

amount.description: The amount of agent tokens to sell, specified in wei units (e.g., '1000000000000000000' for 1 token).

tools.name: ATP_GET_AGENT_POSITIONS
tools.description: Retrieve the positions of the user's agent tokens.

tools.name: ADD_COLLATERAL
tools.description: Add collateral to your BAMM position

bammAddress.description: The address of the BAMM contract

amount.description: The amount of collateral to add

collateralToken.description: The address of the collateral token

collateralTokenSymbol.description: The symbol of the collateral token (e.g., 'IQT')

tools.name: BORROW
tools.description: Borrow tokens from a BAMM position

bammAddress.description: The address of the BAMM contract

borrowToken.description: The address of the token to borrow

borrowTokenSymbol.description: The symbol of the token to borrow (e.g., 'IQT')

tools.name: GET_POSITIONS
tools.description: Get all your active BAMM positions

tools.name: LEND
tools.description: Lend Fraxswap LP tokens to a BAMM contract

bammAddress.description: The address of the BAMM contract

amount.description: The amount of LP tokens to lend

tools.name: POOL_STATS
tools.description: Get statistics for all BAMM pools

tools.name: REMOVE_COLLATERAL
tools.description: Remove collateral from your BAMM position

bammAddress.description: The address of the BAMM contract

amount.description: The amount of collateral to remove

collateralToken.description: The address of the collateral token

collateralTokenSymbol.description: The symbol of the collateral token (e.g., 'IQT')

tools.name: REPAY
tools.description: Repay borrowed tokens to a BAMM position

bammAddress.description: The address of the BAMM contract

borrowToken.description: The address of the token to repay

borrowTokenSymbol.description: The symbol of the token to repay (e.g., 'IQT')

tools.name: FRAXLEND_ADD_COLLATERAL
tools.description: Add collateral to a FraxLend position

pairAddress.description: The contract address of the asset to add as collateral.

amount.description: The amount for the asset to add as collateral in the FraxLend pool.

tools.name: FRAXLEND_GET_POSITIONS
tools.description: Get your positions in FraxLend pools

address.description: The address of the user to get the positions for

tools.name: FRAXLEND_BORROW
tools.description: Borrow assets from a FraxLend pool

pairAddress.description: The contract address of the agent token to sell.

receiver.description: The address to receive the borrowed assets.

collateralAmount.description: The amount for the collateral asset to deposit in the FraxLend pool.

borrowAmount.description: The amount for the asset to borrow from the FraxLend pool.

tools.name: FRAXLEND_GET_STATS
tools.description: Get lending statistics from FraxLend pools

tools.name: FRAXLEND_LEND
tools.description: Lend assets to a FraxLend pool

pairAddress.description: The contract address of the asset to lend.

amount.description: The amount for the asset to lend in the FraxLend pool.

tools.name: FRAXLEND_GET_PAIR_ADDRESS
tools.description: Get FraxLend pair addresses and pool information

assetSymbol.description: The symbol of the asset token.

collateralSymbol.description: The symbol of the collateral token.

sortByApr.description: Sort the results by APR, either highest or lowest.

tools.name: FRAXLEND_REMOVE_COLLATERAL
tools.description: Remove collateral from a FraxLend position

pairAddress.description: The contract address of the asset to remove as collateral.

amount.description: The amount for the asset to remove collateral from the FraxLend pool.

tools.name: FRAXLEND_REPAY
tools.description: Repay borrowed assets to a FraxLend pool

pairAddress.description: The contract address of the asset to repay.

amount.description: The amount for the asset to repay in the FraxLend pool.

tools.name: FRAXLEND_WITHDRAW
tools.description: Withdraw assets from a FraxLend pool

pairAddress.description: The contract address of the asset to withdraw.

amount.description: The amount for the asset to withdraw from the FraxLend pool.

tools.name: GET_WIKI
tools.description: Get details about a specific wiki from IQ.wiki by ID

id.description: The ID of the wiki to retrieve

tools.name: GET_USER_CREATED_WIKIS
tools.description: Get wikis created by a specific user on IQ.wiki

id.description: The Ethereum address of the user

timeFrameSeconds.description: Optional time frame in seconds to filter results

tools.name: GET_USER_EDITED_WIKIS
tools.description: Get wikis edited by a specific user on IQ.wiki

id.description: The Ethereum address of the user

timeFrameSeconds.description: Optional time frame in seconds to filter results

tools.name: GET_USER_WIKI_ACTIVITIES
tools.description: Get wiki activities (creations or edits) for a specific user on IQ.wiki

id.description: The Ethereum address of the user

activityType.description: Type of activity: CREATED or UPDATED

timeFrameSeconds.description: Optional time frame in seconds to filter results

tools.name: SEARCH_WIKI
tools.description: Search for a wiki from IQ.wiki by query

tools.name: watch_near_event
tools.description: Start watching for specific events on a NEAR contract and process them with AI responses

eventName.description: Name of the NEAR event to watch for

responseMethodName.description: Contract method to call with the response (defaults to agent_response)

responseParameterName.description: Name of the parameter to pass to the response method (defaults to response)

cronExpression.description: Cron expression for polling frequency (default: every 10 seconds)

tools.name: stop_watching_near_event
tools.description: Stop watching for specific events on a NEAR contract

contractId.description: NEAR contract ID to stop monitoring

eventName.description: Name of the event to stop watching

tools.name: list_watched_near_events
tools.description: List all currently watched NEAR events and their status

tools.name: GET_NEAR_SWAP_SIMPLE_QUOTE
tools.description: [STEP 1] Get a simple quote for a NEAR intent swap between different chains and assets. This is a dry run that doesn't require any addresses - perfect for users who want to check swap rates and fees before committing to a swap. Use this when users want to explore swap options without providing recipient addresses. NOTE: If users provide simple token names (e.g., 'ETH', 'USDC'), first use GET_NEAR_SWAP_TOKENS to discover the exact token IDs required for this API.

amount.description: Amount to swap as the base amount, denoted in the smallest unit of the specified currency (e.g., wei for ETH)

swapType.description: (Optional, defaults to EXACT_INPUT) Whether to use the amount as input or output for the swap calculation

slippageTolerance.description: (Optional, defaults to 100) Slippage tolerance in basis points (100 = 1%)

quoteWaitingTimeMs.description: (Optional, defaults to 3000) Time in milliseconds to wait for quote from relay

tools.name: GET_NEAR_SWAP_FULL_QUOTE
tools.description: [STEP 2] Get a full quote with deposit address for a NEAR intent swap. This requires recipient and refund addresses and returns a unique deposit address where users can send their funds to initiate the swap. Use this when users are ready to proceed with the swap after checking the simple quote. NOTE: If users provide simple token names (e.g., 'ETH', 'USDC'), first use GET_NEAR_SWAP_TOKENS to discover the exact token IDs required for this API.

swapType.description: (Optional, defaults to EXACT_INPUT) Whether to use the amount as the output or the input for the basis of the swap: EXACT_INPUT - request output amount for exact input, EXACT_OUTPUT - request output amount for exact output. The refundTo address will always receive excess tokens back even after the swap is complete.

amount.description: Amount to swap as the base amount (can be switched to exact input/output using the dedicated flag), denoted in the smallest unit of the specified currency (e.g., wei for ETH)

recipient.description: Recipient address. The format should match recipientType.

recipientType.description: (Optional, defaults to DESTINATION_CHAIN) Type of recipient address: DESTINATION_CHAIN - assets will be transferred to chain of destinationAsset, INTENTS - assets will be transferred to account inside intents

refundType.description: (Optional, defaults to ORIGIN_CHAIN) Type of refund address: ORIGIN_CHAIN - assets will be refunded to refundTo address on the origin chain, INTENTS - assets will be refunded to refundTo intents account

slippageTolerance.description: (Optional, defaults to 100) Slippage tolerance for the swap. This value is in basis points (1/100th of a percent), e.g. 100 for 1% slippage.

dry.description: (Optional, defaults to false) Flag indicating whether this is a dry run request. If true, the response will NOT contain the following fields: depositAddress, timeWhenInactive, deadline.

depositType.description: (Optional, defaults to ORIGIN_CHAIN) Type of the deposit address: ORIGIN_CHAIN - deposit address on the origin chain, INTENTS - account ID inside near intents to which you should transfer assets inside intents

deadline.description: (Optional, defaults to 1 hour from now) Timestamp in ISO format, that identifies when user refund will begin if the swap isn't completed by then. It needs to exceed the time required for the deposit tx to be minted, e.g. for Bitcoin it might require ~1h depending on the gas fees paid.

referral.description: (Optional) Referral identifier (lower case only). It will be reflected in the on-chain data and displayed on public analytics platforms.

quoteWaitingTimeMs.description: (Optional, defaults to 3000) Time in milliseconds user is willing to wait for quote from relay

tools.name: EXECUTE_NEAR_SWAP
tools.description: [STEP 4] Submit a deposit transaction hash to initiate the swap after sending funds to the deposit address. This notifies the 1Click service that funds have been sent and triggers the swap execution process. Use this after users have sent their funds to the deposit address from the full quote response.

txHash.description: Transaction hash of your deposit transaction that was sent to the deposit address from the quote

depositAddress.description: The deposit address that was provided in the quote response and to which the deposit transaction was sent

tools.name: CHECK_NEAR_SWAP_STATUS
tools.description: [STEP 5] Check the current execution status of a NEAR intent swap. Returns the swap state (PENDING_DEPOSIT, PROCESSING, SUCCESS, REFUNDED, FAILED, etc.) along with detailed transaction information. Use this to monitor swap progress after initiating the swap, and continue polling until the swap is complete.

depositAddress.description: The unique deposit address from the quote response - used to track and retrieve the current status of the swap

tools.name: GET_NEAR_SWAP_TOKENS
tools.description: [DISCOVERY] Get a list of tokens currently supported by the 1Click API for NEAR Intents. Returns token metadata including blockchain, contract address, current USD price, symbol, decimals, and price update timestamp. Use this to help users discover available tokens before requesting quotes.

tools.name: ODOS_GET_QUOTE
tools.description: Get a quote for a swap or exchange operation

chain.description: The blockchain network to execute the transaction on. uses fraxtal as default

amount.description: The amount of tokens to swap, in wei.

prettyFormat.description: Whether to pretty format the quote.

tools.name: ODOS_SWAP
tools.description: Execute a swap transaction

chain.description: The blockchain network to execute the transaction on. uses fraxtal as default

amount.description: The amount of tokens to swap, in wei.

prettyFormat.description: Whether to pretty format the quote.

tools.name: ODOS_GET_CHAIN_ID
tools.description: Get the chain ID for a given chain name

chain.description: The chain name to get the ID for

chatId.description: The chat ID or channel username (e.g., @channelname or -1001234567890)

topicId.description: The topic ID for forum channels (optional)

tools.description: Get information about a Telegram channel or chat

channelId.description: The channel ID or username (e.g., @channelname or -1001234567890)

tools.name: FORWARD_MESSAGE
tools.description: Forward a message from one chat to another

messageId.description: ID of the message to forward

tools.name: PIN_MESSAGE
tools.description: Pin a message in a Telegram chat or channel

chatId.description: The chat ID or channel username

messageId.description: ID of the message to pin

tools.name: GET_CHANNEL_MEMBERS
tools.description: Get a list of channel administrators and members

limit.description: Maximum number of members to retrieve (1-50)

tools.name: discord_create_forum_post

tools.name: discord_get_forum_post

tools.name: discord_reply_to_forum

coingecko.name: CoinGecko MCP Client
coingecko.error: Remote MCP endpoint requires browser-based authorization via mcp-remote

coingecko-pro.error: Remote MCP endpoint requires CoinGecko Pro API key authorization

tools.name: GET_TICKER
tools.description: Get the latest ticker data from Upbit for a single market

tools.name: GET_ORDERBOOK
tools.description: Get orderbook snapshot for a given market

tools.name: GET_TRADES
tools.description: Get recent trades for a market

tools.name: GET_ACCOUNTS
tools.description: Get Upbit account balances (requires private API enabled)

tools.name: CREATE_ORDER

tools.name: GET_ORDERS
tools.description: List Upbit orders (requires private API)

tools.name: GET_ORDER
tools.description: Get a single Upbit order (requires private API)

tools.name: CANCEL_ORDER
tools.description: Cancel an existing Upbit order (requires private API)

tools.name: LIST_WITHDRAWAL_ADDRESSES
tools.description: List registered withdrawal-allowed addresses (requires private API)

tools.name: CREATE_WITHDRAWAL
tools.description: Request a digital asset withdrawal (requires private API)

tools.name: GET_WITHDRAWAL

tools.name: LIST_WITHDRAWALS
tools.description: List withdrawals (requires private API)

tools.name: CANCEL_WITHDRAWAL

tools.name: GET_DEPOSIT_CHANCE
tools.description: Get deposit availability information for a currency (private)

tools.name: CREATE_DEPOSIT_ADDRESS
tools.description: Request creation of a deposit address (requires private API)

tools.name: GET_DEPOSIT_ADDRESS
tools.description: Get a single deposit address for a currency and net_type (private)

tools.name: LIST_DEPOSIT_ADDRESSES
tools.description: List deposit addresses for all currencies (requires private API)

tools.name: GET_DEPOSIT
tools.description: Get a single deposit by UUID (requires private API)

tools.name: LIST_DEPOSITS
tools.description: List deposits (requires private API)

tools.name: get_market_by_slug
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific market by its slug identifier. The slug can be extracted from the Polymarket URL.

tools.name: get_event_by_slug
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific event by its slug identifier. Events group multiple related markets.

tools.name: list_active_markets
tools.description: List all currently active markets with pagination. Returns markets that are not yet closed.

limit.description: Number of markets to return (default: 20, max: 100)

offset.description: Number of markets to skip for pagination (default: 0)

tools.name: search_markets
tools.description: Search for markets, events, and profiles using text search.

tools.name: get_markets_by_tag
tools.description: Get markets filtered by a specific tag ID. Useful for finding markets in specific categories.

tag_id.description: The tag ID to filter by

tools.name: get_all_tags
tools.description: Get a list of all available tags for categorizing markets.

tools.name: get_order_book
tools.description: Get the current order book for a specific market token. Shows all active buy and sell orders.

token_id.description: The token ID for the market outcome

tools.name: approve_allowances
tools.description: Grant the USDC and Conditional Tokens approvals required to trade on Polymarket. Automatically approves only the contracts that don't already have approvals set. Includes both regular and NegRisk markets. These approvals are standard ERC20/ERC1155 approvals, revocable at any time in your wallet.

waitForConfirmations.description: How many confirmations to wait before returning (0 = return immediately after broadcasting). Default: 0

tools.name: place_order
tools.description: Place a limit order on Polymarket at a specific price. Specify the number of shares (size) and price (0-1). For both BUY and SELL, you specify the number of shares you want to trade. Example: size=10, price=0.6 means buy/sell 10 shares at $0.60 per share (total: $6).

tokenId.description: The token ID of the market outcome to trade

price.description: The limit price for the order (between 0 and 1). This is the probability/price per share.

size.description: Number of shares to trade. For both BUY and SELL orders, this is always the number of outcome tokens/shares.

side.description: The side of the order: BUY or SELL

orderType.description: Order type: GTC (Good Till Cancelled) or GTD (Good Till Date). Default: GTC

tools.name: place_market_order
tools.description: Place a market order that executes immediately at current market price. IMPORTANT: For BUY orders, amount is the dollar amount ($USD) you want to spend. For SELL orders, amount is the number of shares to sell. Example: amount=5, side=BUY means 'spend $5 to buy shares at market price'. Minimum $1 for BUY orders.

tokenId.description: The token ID of the market outcome to trade

amount.description: BUY orders: Dollar amount ($) to spend. SELL orders: Number of shares to sell. Minimum $1 for BUY orders.

side.description: The side of the order: BUY or SELL

orderType.description: Order type: FOK (Fill or Kill) or FAK (Fill and Kill). Default: FOK

tools.name: get_open_orders
tools.description: Get all open orders for the authenticated account. Can optionally filter by market.

market.description: Optional market address to filter orders by

tools.name: get_order
tools.description: Get details of a specific order by its ID.

orderId.description: The unique identifier of the order

tools.name: cancel_order
tools.description: Cancel a specific order by its ID.

orderId.description: The unique identifier of the order to cancel

tools.name: cancel_all_orders
tools.description: Cancel all open orders for the authenticated account.

tools.name: get_trade_history
tools.description: Get trade history for the authenticated account. Can optionally filter by market or maker address.

market.description: Optional market address to filter trades by

maker_address.description: Optional maker address to filter trades by

tools.name: get_balance_allowance
tools.description: Get balance and allowance information for the authenticated account. Can check COLLATERAL or CONDITIONAL tokens.

assetType.description: Asset type to check balance for: COLLATERAL or CONDITIONAL

tokenID.description: Optional token ID for conditional token balance

tools.name: update_balance_allowance
tools.description: Update balance and allowance for the authenticated account. Required before trading.

assetType.description: Asset type to update allowance for: COLLATERAL or CONDITIONAL

tokenID.description: Optional token ID for conditional token

tools.name: redeem_positions
tools.description: Redeem (claim) winnings from a resolved Polymarket prediction market. Use this to collect USDC from positions in markets that have been settled. For regular markets, you need the conditionId. For negative risk markets, you also need the tokenId and should set negRisk=true. The market must be resolved before redemption is possible.

conditionId.description: The condition ID (market ID) for the resolved market. This is typically a 32-byte hex string.

tokenId.description: The token ID of the position to redeem. Required for negRisk markets, optional for regular markets.

outcomeIndex.description: The outcome index: 0 for Yes/first outcome, 1 for No/second outcome. Used for negRisk markets to determine which tokens to redeem.

negRisk.description: Whether this is a negative risk market. Negative risk markets use the NegRiskAdapter contract for redemption. Default: false

tools.name: get_positions
tools.description: Get all positions for a wallet address with current values. Returns position details including size, current price, current value, and P&L. Uses the Polymarket Data API for accurate position valuation.

user.description: Wallet address to fetch positions for. If not provided, uses POLYMARKET_FUNDER env var.

limit.description: Maximum number of positions to return (default: 100)

tools.name: debank_get_supported_chain_list
tools.description: Retrieve a comprehensive list of all blockchain chains supported by the DeBank API. Returns information about each chain including their IDs, names, logo URLs, native token IDs, wrapped token IDs, and pre-execution support status. Use this to discover available chains before calling other chain-specific endpoints.

tools.name: debank_get_chain
tools.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific blockchain chain supported by DeBank. Returns chain details including ID, name, logo URL, native token ID, wrapped token ID, and whether it supports pre-execution of transactions. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_all_protocols_of_supported_chains
tools.description: Retrieve a list of all DeFi protocols across specified or all supported blockchain chains. Returns essential information about each protocol including ID, chain ID, name, logo URL, site URL, portfolio support status, and TVL. Returns top 20 protocols by default. Filter by specific chains using chain_ids parameter. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC, Polygon') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth,bsc,matic').

chain_ids.description: Comma-separated chain names or IDs - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC''eth,bsc', 'Polygon''matic'). If omitted, returns protocols across all supported chains. Existing chain IDs like 'eth,bsc,matic' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_protocol_information
tools.description: Fetch detailed information about a specific DeFi protocol. Returns protocol details including ID, associated chain, name, logo URL, site URL, portfolio support status, and total value locked (TVL). Useful for analyzing individual protocols across different chains.

id.description: The unique identifier of the protocol (e.g., 'bsc_pancakeswap' for PancakeSwap on BSC, 'uniswap', 'aave', 'curve'). Use debank_get_all_protocols_of_supported_chains to discover protocol IDs.

tools.name: debank_get_top_holders_of_protocol
tools.description: Retrieve a list of top holders within a specified DeFi protocol, ranked by their holdings. Provides insights into the distribution and concentration of holdings among participants. Supports pagination for large result sets.

id.description: The unique identifier of the protocol (e.g., 'uniswap', 'aave', 'compound'). Use debank_get_all_protocols_of_supported_chains to find protocol IDs.

start.description: Pagination offset to specify where to start in the list. Default is 0, maximum is 1000.

limit.description: Maximum number of top holders to retrieve. Default and maximum is 100.

tools.name: debank_get_pool_information
tools.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific liquidity pool. Returns pool details including ID, chain, protocol ID, contract IDs, name, USD value of deposited assets, total user count, and count of valuable users (>$100 USD value). Essential for analyzing specific pools for investment or research. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

id.description: The unique identifier of the pool (typically a contract address, e.g., '0x00000000219ab540356cbb839cbe05303d7705fa').

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_token_information
tools.description: Fetch comprehensive details about a specific token on a blockchain. Returns token information including contract address, chain, name, symbol, decimals, logo URL, associated protocol ID, USD price, verification status, and deployment timestamp. Essential for token analysis and display. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc'). **WRAPPED TOKEN RESOLUTION:** Keywords like 'WETH', 'wrapped native', or 'native token' automatically resolve to the chain's wrapped token address.

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

id.description: Token contract address, native token ID, or wrapped token keyword. Auto-resolves: 'WETH'WETH address, 'wrapped native'chain's wrapped token, 'native token'chain's wrapped token. Examples: 'WETH', 'wrapped ETH', 'native token', '0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7' (USDT).

tools.name: debank_get_list_token_information
tools.description: Retrieve detailed information for multiple tokens at once on a specific chain. Returns an array of token objects with comprehensive details. Useful for bulk token data retrieval, with support for up to 100 token addresses per request. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

ids.description: Comma-separated list of token addresses (up to 100). Example: '0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7,0xa0b86991c6218b36c1d19d4a2e9eb0ce3606eb48'

tools.name: debank_get_top_holders_of_token
tools.description: Fetch the top holders of a specified token, showing the largest token holders ranked by their holdings. Supports both contract addresses and native token IDs. Useful for analyzing token distribution and ownership concentration. Supports pagination for detailed analysis. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc'). **WRAPPED TOKEN RESOLUTION:** Keywords like 'WETH', 'wrapped native', or 'native token' automatically resolve to the chain's wrapped token address.

id.description: Token contract address, native token ID, or wrapped token keyword. Auto-resolves: 'WETH'WETH address, 'wrapped native'chain's wrapped token, 'native token'chain's wrapped token. Examples: 'WETH', 'wrapped BNB', '0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7'.

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

start.description: Pagination offset. Default is 0, maximum is 10000.

limit.description: Maximum number of holders to return. Default is 100.

tools.name: debank_get_token_history_price
tools.description: Retrieve the historical price of a specified token for a given date. Essential for financial analysis, historical comparison, and tracking price movements over time. Returns price data for the UTC time zone on the specified date. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc'). **WRAPPED TOKEN RESOLUTION:** Keywords like 'WETH', 'wrapped native', or 'native token' automatically resolve to the chain's wrapped token address.

id.description: Token contract address, native token ID, or wrapped token keyword. Auto-resolves: 'WETH'WETH address, 'wrapped native'chain's wrapped token, 'native token'chain's wrapped token. Examples: 'WETH', 'wrapped MATIC', '0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7'.

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

date_at.description: The date for historical price data in UTC time zone. Format: YYYY-MM-DD (e.g., '2023-05-18').

tools.name: debank_get_user_used_chain_list
tools.description: Retrieve a list of blockchain chains that a specific user has interacted with. Returns details about each chain including ID, name, logo URL, native token ID, wrapped token ID, and the birth time of the user's address on each chain.

tools.name: debank_get_user_chain_balance
tools.description: Fetch the current balance of a user's account on a specified blockchain chain. Returns the balance in USD value, providing a snapshot of the user's holdings on that chain. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_user_protocol
tools.description: Get detailed information about a user's positions within a specified DeFi protocol. Returns protocol details and the user's portfolio items including assets, debts, and rewards in that protocol.

protocol_id.description: The protocol ID (e.g., 'bsc_pancakeswap', 'uniswap', 'aave')Use debank_get_all_protocols_of_supported_chains to discover protocol IDs..

tools.name: debank_get_user_complex_protocol_list
tools.description: Retrieve detailed portfolios of a user on a specific chain across multiple protocols. Returns comprehensive information about the user's engagements including protocol details and portfolio items with assets, debts, and positions. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_user_all_complex_protocol_list
tools.description: Retrieve a user's detailed portfolios across all supported chains within multiple protocols. Provides a comprehensive overview of investments and positions across the entire DeFi ecosystem. Can be filtered by specific chains. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC, Polygon') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth,bsc,matic').

chain_ids.description: Comma-separated chain names or IDs - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC''eth,bsc', 'Polygon''matic'). If omitted, includes all supported chains. Existing chain IDs like 'eth,bsc,matic' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_user_all_simple_protocol_list
tools.description: Fetch a user's balances in protocols across all supported chains. Returns simplified protocol information including TVL and basic details. Useful for getting a quick overview of a user's protocol engagements. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC, Polygon') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth,bsc,matic').

chain_ids.description: Comma-separated chain names or IDs - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC, Polygon''eth,bsc,matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). If omitted, includes all supported chains. Existing chain IDs like 'eth,bsc,polygon' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_user_token_balance
tools.description: Retrieve a user's balance for a specific token. Returns detailed token information including name, symbol, decimals, USD price, and the user's balance amount. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc'). **WRAPPED TOKEN RESOLUTION:** Keywords like 'WETH', 'wrapped native', or 'native token' automatically resolve to the chain's wrapped token address.

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

token_id.description: Token contract address, native token ID, or wrapped token keyword. Auto-resolves: 'WETH'WETH address, 'wrapped native'chain's wrapped token, 'native token'chain's wrapped token. Examples: 'WETH', 'wrapped token', '0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7'.

tools.name: debank_get_user_token_list
tools.description: Retrieve a list of tokens held by a user on a specific chain. Returns token details including symbol, decimals, USD price, and balance amounts. Can filter for core/verified tokens or include all tokens. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

is_all.description: If true, returns all tokens including non-core tokens. Default is true.

tools.name: debank_get_user_all_token_list
tools.description: Retrieve a user's token balances across all supported chains. Provides a comprehensive list of all tokens held by the user, offering insights into their wider cryptocurrency portfolio.

is_all.description: If true, includes all tokens in the response. Default is true.

tools.name: debank_get_user_nft_list
tools.description: Fetch a list of NFTs owned by a user on a specific chain. Returns NFT details including contract ID, name, description, content type, and attributes. Can filter for verified collections only. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

is_all.description: If false, only returns NFTs from verified collections. Default is true.

tools.name: debank_get_user_all_nft_list
tools.description: Retrieve a user's NFT holdings across all supported chains. Provides an aggregate list of NFTs held by the user with details including contract ID, name, and content type. Can be filtered by specific chains. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC, Polygon') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth,bsc,matic').

is_all.description: If true, includes all NFTs. Default is true.

chain_ids.description: Comma-separated chain names or IDs - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC, Polygon''eth,bsc,matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). If omitted, includes all supported chains. Existing chain IDs like 'eth,bsc,polygon' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_user_history_list
tools.description: Fetch a user's transaction history on a specified chain. Returns a list of past transactions with details including transaction type, tokens involved, values, and timestamps. Supports filtering by token and pagination. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc'). **WRAPPED TOKEN RESOLUTION:** Keywords like 'WETH', 'wrapped native', or 'native token' automatically resolve to the chain's wrapped token address.

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

token_id.description: Optional token contract address, native token ID, or wrapped token keyword to filter history. Auto-resolves: 'WETH'WETH address, 'wrapped native'chain's wrapped token, 'native token'chain's wrapped token.

start_time.description: Optional timestamp to return history earlier than this time (Unix timestamp).

page_count.description: Number of entries to return. Maximum is 20.

tools.name: debank_get_user_all_history_list
tools.description: Retrieve a user's transaction history across all supported chains. Provides a comprehensive overview of DeFi activities across the entire blockchain ecosystem. Supports pagination and chain filtering. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC, Polygon') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth,bsc,matic').

start_time.description: Optional timestamp to return history earlier than this time.

page_count.description: Number of entries to return. Maximum is 20.

chain_ids.description: Comma-separated chain names or IDs - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC, Polygon''eth,bsc,matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). If omitted, includes all supported chains. Existing chain IDs like 'eth,bsc,polygon' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_user_token_authorized_list
tools.description: Fetch a list of tokens for which a user has granted spending approvals on a specified chain. Returns details about each approval including amount, spender address, and associated protocol information. Useful for security audits. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_user_nft_authorized_list
tools.description: Retrieve a list of NFTs for which a user has given spending permissions on a specified chain. Returns details including contract IDs, names, symbols, spender addresses, and approved amounts for ERC1155 tokens. Important for security reviews. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_user_total_balance
tools.description: Retrieve a user's total net assets across all supported chains. Calculates and returns the total USD value of assets including both tokens and protocol positions. Provides a complete snapshot of the user's DeFi portfolio.

tools.name: debank_get_user_chain_net_curve
tools.description: Retrieve a user's 24-hour net asset value curve on a single chain. Shows the changes in total USD value of assets over the last 24 hours, providing insights into portfolio fluctuations on that specific chain. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_user_total_net_curve
tools.description: Retrieve a user's 24-hour net asset value curve across all chains. Provides a comprehensive view of total USD value changes over the last 24 hours, helping track overall portfolio performance. Can be filtered by specific chains. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC, Polygon') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth,bsc,matic').

chain_ids.description: Comma-separated chain names or IDs - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum, BSC, Polygon''eth,bsc,matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). If omitted, includes all supported chains. Existing chain IDs like 'eth,bsc,polygon' also work.

tools.name: debank_get_gas_prices
tools.description: Fetch current gas prices for different transaction speed levels on a specified chain. Returns prices for slow, normal, and fast transaction speeds with estimated confirmation times. Crucial for transaction cost estimation. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass chain names as users mention them (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Binance Smart Chain') - automatically resolved to chain IDs ('eth', 'bsc').

chain_id.description: Chain name or ID - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum''eth', 'BSC''bsc', 'Polygon''matic', 'Arbitrum''arb'). Existing chain IDs like 'eth', 'bsc' also work.

tools.name: debank_pre_exec_transaction
tools.description: Simulate the execution of a transaction or sequence of transactions before submitting them on-chain. Returns detailed information about balance changes, gas estimates, and success status. Useful for DEX swaps requiring token approvals or complex transaction sequences.

tx.description: The main transaction object as a JSON string. Must include fields like from, to, data, value, etc.

pending_tx_list.description: Optional JSON string array of transactions to execute before the main transaction (e.g., approval transactions).

tools.name: debank_explain_transaction
tools.description: Decode and explain a given transaction in human-readable terms. Returns details about function calls, parameters, and actions derived from the transaction data. Supports complex transactions across multiple protocols.

tx.description: The transaction object as a JSON string to be explained. Must include transaction data field.

tools.name: defillama_get_chains
tools.description: Fetches blockchain chains ranked by Total Value Locked (TVL), returning the top 20. Use this tool to: (1) answer user queries about leading DeFi blockchains, or (2) discover valid chain name formats before calling other tools. The returned chain names (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'Arbitrum', 'Polygon') can be used directly in the 'chain' parameter of defillama_get_dexs_data, defillama_get_fees_and_revenue, and defillama_get_historical_chain_tvl

order.description: Sort order by TVL. Use 'desc' (default) for highest TVL first (e.g., Ethereum, BSC, Tron), or 'asc' for lowest TVL first

tools.name: defillama_get_protocol_data
tools.description: Fetches TVL (Total Value Locked) data for DeFi protocols. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Pass protocol names as users mention them (e.g., 'Lido', 'Uniswap', 'Aave', 'MakerDAO') - they're automatically resolved to correct slugs via AI. For multiple versions, specify the version (e.g., 'Aave V3') or the most common version is matched. If protocol parameter is omitted, returns top 10 protocols sorted by your chosen criteria.

protocol.description: Protocol name as mentioned by the user - auto-resolved via AI (e.g., 'Lido', 'Uniswap', 'Aave V3', 'Curve', 'MakerDAO'). Exact slugs also work. Flexible matching handles name variations. If omitted, returns top 10 protocols sorted by the specified condition.

sortCondition.description: Field to sort results by. Only used when protocol parameter is omitted.

order.description: Sort order. Only used when protocol parameter is omitted.

tools.name: defillama_get_historical_chain_tvl
tools.description: Fetches historical TVL (Total Value Locked) data for blockchain chains over time. Returns the last 10 data points showing TVL evolution. Can return data for a specific chain or aggregated data across all chains. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Chain names are automatically matched (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Polygon', 'Avalanche').

chain.description: Blockchain name - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'Arbitrum', 'Polygon', 'BSC', 'Avalanche'). Common variations are handled automatically. If omitted, returns aggregated historical TVL across all chains combined

tools.name: defillama_get_dexs_data
tools.description: Fetches DEX (decentralized exchange) trading volume data and metrics. Returns different levels of data based on parameters: specific protocol data (most detailed), chain-specific overview, or global overview (all DEXs). **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Protocol and chain names are automatically matched.

excludeTotalDataChart.description: Whether to exclude total data chart from response

excludeTotalDataChartBreakdown.description: Whether to exclude chart breakdown from response

protocol.description: DEX protocol name - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Uniswap', 'PancakeSwap', 'Curve'). When provided, returns detailed data for that protocol only. Takes priority over chain parameter

chain.description: Blockchain name - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'BSC', 'Polygon', 'Arbitrum'). Returns overview of all DEXs operating on that chain. Only used when protocol is not specified. If both protocol and chain are omitted, returns global overview of all DEXs

tools.name: defillama_get_fees_and_revenue
tools.description: Fetches fees and revenue metrics for DeFi protocols. Can filter by specific protocol and/or chain. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Protocol and chain names are automatically matched.

excludeTotalDataChart.description: Whether to exclude total data chart

chain.description: Chain name - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'Polygon', 'BSC'). If omitted, includes all chains

protocol.description: Protocol name - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Uniswap', 'Aave'). If omitted, includes all protocols

tools.name: defillama_get_stablecoin
tools.description: Fetches stablecoin data including circulation and price information. Returns top 20 stablecoins

tools.name: defillama_get_stablecoin_chains
tools.description: Fetches stablecoin data by chains. Returns last 3 chains with market cap data

tools.name: defillama_get_stablecoin_charts
tools.description: Fetches historical market cap charts for stablecoins over time. Returns the last 10 data points showing circulation, USD values, and bridged amounts. Can filter by blockchain or specific stablecoin, or show global aggregated data

stablecoin.description: Stablecoin ID or name (e.g., 1 for USDT, 2 for USDC, or 'USDC', 'Tether', 'DAI'). **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** You can now pass stablecoin names directly (like 'USDC', 'Tether', 'DAI') and they will be automatically resolved to their numeric IDs. Numeric IDs are also still accepted. Can be combined with chain parameter to show that stablecoin's data on a specific chain

chain.description: Blockchain name to filter stablecoin data by (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'Polygon', 'Arbitrum'). Returns stablecoin market cap data for that specific chain. **If the user mentions a blockchain but you're unsure of the exact name format, call defillama_get_chains first to discover valid chain names**. If omitted, returns global aggregated data across all chains

tools.name: defillama_get_stablecoin_prices
tools.description: Fetches historical stablecoin price data. Returns last 3 data points

tools.name: defillama_get_prices_current_coins
tools.description: Fetches current token prices from DefiLlama. Requires token addresses in the format chain:address (e.g., 'ethereum:0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7' for USDT). Can fetch multiple tokens at once by comma-separating them

coins.description: Comma-separated list of tokens in the format {chain}:{contractAddress}. Examples: 'ethereum:0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7' (single token), 'ethereum:0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7,bsc:0x55d398326f99059ff775485246999027b3197955' (multiple tokens). If the user mentions a token but you don't know its contract address, you may need to search for it first or ask the user. If unsure about the exact chain name format, call defillama_get_chains to see available chains (e.g., 'ethereum', 'bsc', 'polygon', 'arbitrum')

searchWidth.description: Time window to search for price data. Accepts duration strings (e.g., '4h', '1d', '30m') or seconds as a number (e.g., 600 for 10 minutes). Defaults to 4 hours. Use larger values if recent price data might not be available

tools.name: defillama_get_prices_first_coins
tools.description: Fetches the first recorded historical prices for specified cryptocurrency tokens. Useful for finding when a token was first listed/tracked or its initial price point

coins.description: Comma-separated list of tokens in the format '{chain}:{tokenAddress}'. Each token must specify its blockchain and contract address. Examples: 'ethereum:0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7' (USDT), 'bsc:0x55d398326f99059ff775485246999027b3197955' (USDT on BSC), or multiple tokens: 'ethereum:0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7,ethereum:0xa0b86991c6218b36c1d19d4a2e9eb0ce3606eb48'. Chain names must match exactly - if unsure about the correct chain name format, call defillama_get_chains first to discover valid chain names (e.g., 'ethereum' not 'Ethereum', 'bsc' not 'BSC'). Token addresses are checksummed contract addresses on the specified chain

tools.name: defillama_get_batch_historical
tools.description: Fetches historical price data for multiple cryptocurrencies at specific timestamps. Useful for getting prices of multiple coins at the same or different points in time

coins.description: Coin identifiers with timestamps. Use object format: { 'chain:address': [timestamp1, timestamp2, ...] }. Examples: { 'ethereum:0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7': [1648680149] } for USDT on Ethereum, or { 'coingecko:bitcoin': [1648680149, 1648766549] } for Bitcoin at multiple times. Chain names should match format from defillama_get_chains (e.g., 'ethereum', 'bsc', 'polygon'). For well-known coins, use 'coingecko:' prefix with coin ID. Timestamps are Unix timestamps in seconds. If you're unsure about the correct chain:address format for a token, you may need to search for the token's contract address first

searchWidth.description: Time range around each timestamp to search for price data. Accepts duration strings (e.g., '4h', '1d', '30m') or seconds as a number (e.g., 600 for 10 minutes). Defaults to '6h' (6 hours). Wider ranges increase chances of finding data but may be less precise

tools.name: defillama_get_historical_prices_by_contract
tools.description: Fetches historical prices for tokens at a specific point in time using their contract addresses. Useful for getting price data at exact timestamps for analysis or backtesting

coins.description: Comma-separated list of tokens in format '{chain}:{contractAddress}'. Each token must specify its blockchain and contract address. Examples: 'ethereum:0xdF574c24545E5FfEcb9a659c229253D4111d87e1' (single token) or 'ethereum:0xdF574c24545E5FfEcb9a659c229253D4111d87e1,bsc:0x762539b45a1dcce3d36d080f74d1aed37844b878' (multiple tokens). **IMPORTANT: If user mentions a chain name, call defillama_get_chains first to get the correct chain identifier. For contract addresses, ensure you have the exact address for the token on that specific chain**

timestamp.description: Point in time to query prices for. Accepts Unix timestamp (seconds) or ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-01-15T12:00:00Z'). Example: 1705320000 or '2024-01-15T12:00:00Z'

searchWidth.description: Time window to search for price data around the timestamp if exact data unavailable. Accepts duration string (e.g., '4h', '1d') or seconds (e.g., 600). Defaults to 6 hours. Larger windows increase chances of finding data but may be less accurate

tools.name: defillama_get_percentage_coins
tools.description: Fetches percentage price change for tokens over a specified time period. Calculates how much token prices changed from a starting point, either looking backward (default) or forward in time

coins.description: Comma-separated list of tokens in format '{chain}:{contractAddress}'. Each token must specify its blockchain and contract address. Examples: 'ethereum:0xdF574c24545E5FfEcb9a659c229253D4111d87e1' (single token) or 'ethereum:0xdF574c24545E5FfEcb9a659c229253D4111d87e1,bsc:0x762539b45a1dcce3d36d080f74d1aed37844b878,ethereum:0xdB25f211AB05b1c97D595516F45794528a807ad8' (multiple tokens). **IMPORTANT: If user mentions a chain name, call defillama_get_chains first to get the correct chain identifier. For contract addresses, ensure you have the exact address for the token on that specific chain**

timestamp.description: Starting point in time for percentage calculation. Accepts Unix timestamp (seconds) or ISO 8601 format. If omitted, uses current time. Examples: 1705320000 or '2024-01-15T12:00:00Z'

period.description: Time period over which to calculate percentage change. Format: number + unit (h=hours, d=days). Examples: '1h' (1 hour), '8h' (8 hours), '2d' (2 days), '7d' (7 days). Defaults to '1d' (24 hours)

lookForward.description: Direction to calculate change. If false (default), calculates change from [timestamp - period] to [timestamp] (looking backward). If true, calculates change from [timestamp] to [timestamp + period] (looking forward). Use true for historical predictions/projections

tools.name: defillama_get_chart_coins
tools.description: Fetches historical price chart data for one or more cryptocurrency tokens across different blockchains. Returns time-series price data with customizable time range and data point frequency

coins.description: Comma-separated list of tokens in the format '{chain}:{contractAddress}'. Each token must be specified with its blockchain and contract address. Examples: 'ethereum:0xdF574c24545E5FfEcb9a659c229253D4111d87e1' (single token), 'ethereum:0xdF574c24545E5FfEcb9a659c229253D4111d87e1,bsc:0x762539b45a1dcce3d36d080f74d1aed37844b878' (multiple tokens). You can also use CoinGecko IDs like 'coingecko:ethereum'. If you don't know the contract address for a token, search for it first using other available tools or use the CoinGecko ID format

start.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) for the earliest data point. If omitted, defaults to earliest available data. Example: 1640995200 (Jan 1, 2022)

end.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) for the latest data point. If omitted, defaults to current time. Example: 1672531200 (Jan 1, 2023)

span.description: Number of data points to return in the chart. Higher values provide more granular data. If omitted, returns all available points within the time range. Example: 10 returns 10 evenly-spaced data points

period.description: Time interval between data points. Determines chart granularity. Format: number + unit (h for hours, d for days). Examples: '1h' (hourly data), '8h' (every 8 hours), '1d' (daily data), '7d' (weekly data). If omitted, defaults to 24 hours (daily)

searchWidth.description: Time window for finding price data around each period point. Can be specified as seconds (number) or duration string. Wider search windows are more forgiving but may be less precise. Examples: '600' (10 minutes), '6h' (6 hours). Defaults to 6 hours

tools.name: defillama_get_latest_pool_data
tools.description: Fetches current yield farming pool data including APY rates, TVL, and rewards. Returns a list of pools that can be filtered and sorted by various metrics

sortCondition.description: Field to sort results by (e.g., tvlUsd for total value locked, apy for annual percentage yield)

tools.name: defillama_get_historical_pool_data
tools.description: Fetches historical APY and TVL data for a specific yield farming pool over time. Returns the last 10 data points showing how the pool's metrics have changed

pool.description: Unique pool identifier (UUID format). **IMPORTANT: Always call defillama_get_latest_pool_data first** to discover available pools and their IDs. The pool ID is returned in the 'pool' property of each result (e.g., '742c4e8f-1f3d-4c3e-9c1e-2a3b4c5d6e7f')

tools.name: defillama_get_options_data
tools.description: Fetches options protocol data including trading volume and premium metrics. Returns different levels of data: specific protocol data (most detailed), chain-specific overview, or global overview (all options protocols). **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Protocol and chain names are automatically matched.

dataType.description: Type of volume data to retrieve: premium volume (actual premiums paid) or notional volume (value of underlying assets)

protocol.description: Options protocol name - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Lyra', 'Hegic', 'Aevo'). When provided, returns detailed data for that protocol only. Takes priority over chain parameter

chain.description: Blockchain name - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'Arbitrum', 'Optimism'). Returns overview of all options protocols operating on that chain. Only used when protocol is not specified. If both protocol and chain are omitted, returns global overview of all options protocols

excludeTotalDataChart.description: Whether to exclude aggregated chart data from response

excludeTotalDataChartBreakdown.description: Whether to exclude broken down chart data from response

tools.name: defillama_get_blockchain_timestamp
tools.description: Fetches blockchain block information for a specific chain at a given timestamp. Returns the block number, timestamp, and height that existed at that point in time. This is essential for historical DeFi queries - many blockchain APIs require a specific block number to retrieve historical state (e.g., 'What was the TVL on date X?' requires knowing which block number corresponded to date X). Use this tool to convert human-readable dates into block numbers. **AUTO-RESOLUTION ENABLED:** Chain names are automatically matched.

chain.description: Blockchain name - auto-resolved (e.g., 'Ethereum', 'Polygon', 'Arbitrum', 'Avalanche', 'BSC'). Common variations are handled automatically

timestamp.description: Time to query block data for. Accepts both Unix timestamp in seconds (e.g., 1640000000) or ISO 8601 date string (e.g., '2024-01-15T10:30:00Z', '2024-01-15'). Relative dates work too - the converter will handle them. Will be automatically converted to Unix timestamp for the API call

tools.name: GET_MARKETS
tools.description: List and discover prediction markets on Kalshi. Markets represent binary outcomes users can trade on. Returns paginated results with market details including ticker, title, prices, and volume.

limit.description: Number of results per page (1-1000, default 100)

tools.name: GET_MARKET
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific prediction market by its ticker, including current prices, volume, open interest, and settlement rules.

tools.name: GET_MARKET_ORDERBOOK
tools.description: Get the current orderbook for a market showing bid prices and quantities for both Yes and No sides.

depth.description: Depth of orderbook to retrieve (1-100, default 10)

tools.name: GET_TRADES
tools.description: Get recent public trades across all markets or for a specific market. Each trade shows price, quantity, and timestamp.

minTs.description: Filter trades after this Unix timestamp

maxTs.description: Filter trades before this Unix timestamp

tools.name: GET_SERIES
tools.description: Get information about a series, which is a template for recurring events (e.g., monthly jobs reports, daily weather).

tools.name: GET_BALANCE
tools.description: Get the current account balance and portfolio value. Values are returned in dollars.

tools.name: GET_POSITIONS
tools.description: Get your current portfolio positions showing market exposure, cost basis, and P&L for each position.

countFilter.description: Filter: 'position' for non-zero positions, 'total_traded' for traded

tools.name: GET_FILLS
tools.description: Get your trade fill history. A fill occurs when your order is matched with another trader.

minTs.description: Filter fills after this Unix timestamp

maxTs.description: Filter fills before this Unix timestamp

tools.name: GET_SETTLEMENTS
tools.description: Get your settlement history showing resolved markets and their payouts.

minTs.description: Filter settlements after this Unix timestamp

maxTs.description: Filter settlements before this Unix timestamp

tools.name: GET_ORDERS
tools.description: Get your orders with optional filtering by market, status, or time range.

tools.name: GET_ORDER
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific order by its ID.

tools.name: CREATE_ORDER
tools.description: Create a new order to buy or sell contracts in a prediction market. Use limit orders with a price, or market orders for immediate execution.

yesPrice.description: Yes price in cents (1-99) - required for limit orders on yes side

noPrice.description: No price in cents (1-99) - required for limit orders on no side

postOnly.description: If true, order will only be placed if it will rest on the book

reduceOnly.description: If true, order will only reduce existing position

tools.name: CANCEL_ORDER
tools.description: Cancel an existing open order by its ID.

tools.name: BATCH_CANCEL_ORDERS
tools.description: Cancel multiple orders at once (up to 20 orders per batch).

ids.description: Array of order IDs to cancel (max 20)

tools.name: DECREASE_ORDER
tools.description: Decrease the quantity of an existing order. This is the only way to reduce order size without fully canceling.

reduceBy.description: Number of contracts to reduce by

tools.name: GET_AUTH_STATUS
tools.description: Check the current authentication status for the Limitless API session. Returns whether you're logged in and your Ethereum address. Session persists automatically across all tool calls.

tools.name: GET_SIGNING_MESSAGE
tools.description: Get a signing message with a randomly generated nonce for authentication purposes. Use this before logging in. Requires a wallet address.

address.description: The wallet address to get a signing message for

tools.name: VERIFY_AUTH
tools.description: Verify if the user is authenticated by checking the session cookie. Returns the authenticated Ethereum address.

tools.name: LOGIN
tools.description: Authenticate a user with a signed message and create a session. First get a signing message, sign it with your wallet, then call this with the signature.

account.description: The Ethereum address of the user

signingMessage.description: The signing message generated by the server

signature.description: The signature generated by signing the message with the wallet

tools.name: LOGOUT
tools.description: Log out the user by clearing the session cookie. Requires authentication.

tools.name: SEARCH_MARKETS
tools.description: Search for prediction markets on Limitless based on semantic similarity. Returns markets matching the search query with details like volume, liquidity, and end dates.

tools.name: GET_MARKET
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific prediction market on Limitless. Provides market question, outcomes, prices, volume, liquidity, and other trading data.

addressOrSlug.description: Market address (0x...) or slug identifier (e.g., crypto-predictions-2025)

tools.name: GET_ACTIVE_MARKETS
tools.description: Browse active (unresolved) prediction markets on Limitless. Returns markets with volume, liquidity, and other trading data. Supports filtering by category and sorting.

sortBy.description: Sort order: newest, oldest, volume, liquidity (default: newest)

tools.name: GET_ACTIVE_MARKETS_BY_CATEGORY
tools.description: Browse active (unresolved) markets filtered by category ID with optional pagination and sorting.

categoryId.description: Category ID to filter markets by

tools.name: GET_CATEGORIES
tools.description: Get all available categories on Limitless with their IDs, names, priorities, and metadata. Use this to discover available categories for filtering markets.

tools.name: GET_CATEGORIES_COUNT
tools.description: Get the number of active markets for each category and the total market count.

tools.name: GET_ACTIVE_SLUGS
tools.description: Get slugs, strike prices, tickers, and deadlines for all active markets and groups. Useful for discovering available markets.

tools.name: GET_MARKET_ORDERBOOK
tools.description: Get the current orderbook for a prediction market on Limitless. Shows all open buy (bids) and sell (asks) orders with prices and sizes.

tools.name: GET_HISTORICAL_PRICE
tools.description: Retrieve historical price data for a specific market with configurable time intervals. Useful for analyzing price trends.

from.description: Start date for historical data (ISO 8601 format)

to.description: End date for historical data (ISO 8601 format)

tools.name: GET_FEED_EVENTS
tools.description: Get the latest feed events related to a specific market with pagination support.

tools.name: GET_MARKET_EVENTS
tools.description: Get recent events for a specific market including trades, orders, and liquidity changes.

tools.name: GET_LOCKED_BALANCE
tools.description: Get the amount of funds locked in open orders for the authenticated user in a specific market. Requires authentication.

tools.name: GET_USER_ORDERS
tools.description: Get all orders placed by the authenticated user for a specific market. Requires authentication.

tools.name: GET_PORTFOLIO_POSITIONS
tools.description: Get your active portfolio positions on Limitless with P&L calculations and market values. Requires authentication via session token.

tools.name: GET_PORTFOLIO_TRADES
tools.description: Retrieve all trades executed by the authenticated user. Requires authentication.

tools.name: GET_PORTFOLIO_HISTORY
tools.description: Get paginated history including AMM trades, CLOB trades, splits/merges, and NegRisk conversions. Requires authentication.

tools.name: GET_PORTFOLIO_POINTS
tools.description: Get points breakdown for the authenticated user. Requires authentication.

tools.name: GET_USER_TRADED_VOLUME
tools.description: Get total traded volume and statistics for a specific user. This is a public endpoint that doesn't require authentication.

tools.name: GET_PUBLIC_USER_POSITIONS
tools.description: Get all positions for a specific user address. This is a public endpoint that doesn't require authentication.

tools.name: GET_USER_PROFILE
tools.description: Get detailed profile information for a user by their Ethereum address. Returns comprehensive user data including username, bio, profile picture, rank, points, leaderboard position, referral information, and account status. Requires authentication. Users can view their own profile when authenticated.

address.description: The Ethereum address of the user whose profile to retrieve

tools.name: GET_TRADING_ALLOWANCE
tools.description: Check USDC allowance for CLOB or NegRisk trading contracts. Requires authentication.

tools.name: CREATE_ORDER
tools.description: Create a buy or sell order for prediction market positions on Limitless. Requires signed order data and authentication. Returns order details and match information if filled immediately.

salt.description: Unique random value for signature uniqueness

maker.description: Ethereum address of the maker (order creator)

taker.description: Specific taker address (0x0 for open orders)

tokenId.description: Token ID being traded (YES or NO position)

takerAmount.description: Amount maker wants in return (in wei)

order.description: Order details including signature and amounts

ownerId.description: Profile ID of the order owner

orderType.description: Order type (GTC=Good Till Cancelled, FOK=Fill Or Kill)

tools.name: CANCEL_ORDER
tools.description: Cancel an open order on Limitless and return locked funds. Requires authentication and order ownership.

orderId.description: Unique identifier of the order to be cancelled

tools.name: CANCEL_ORDER_BATCH
tools.description: Cancel multiple orders in a single batch operation on Limitless. All orders must be from the same market. Requires authentication and order ownership.

orderIds.description: Array of order IDs to be cancelled in a single batch operation

tools.name: CANCEL_ALL_ORDERS
tools.description: Cancel all of a user's open orders in a specific market on Limitless. Requires authentication.

slug.description: Market slug to cancel all user orders in

tools.name: GET_MARKETS
tools.description: Get a list of prediction markets from Opinion.trade with optional filters for status and market type

tools.name: GET_MARKET_DETAILS
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific prediction market by its ID

marketId.description: The unique identifier of the market

tools.name: SEARCH_MARKETS
tools.description: Search for prediction markets by keyword in the market title

query.description: Search keyword to find in market titles

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

tools.name: GET_ORDERBOOK
tools.description: Get the order book (bids and asks) for a specific prediction market token

tokenId.description: The token ID to get the order book for

tools.name: GET_PRICE_HISTORY
tools.description: Get historical price data for a prediction market token

tokenId.description: The token ID to get price history for

interval.description: Time interval: 1m (1 minute), 5m (5 minutes), 1h (1 hour), 1d (1 day)

tools.name: GET_LATEST_PRICE
tools.description: Get the current/latest trade price for a prediction market token

tokenId.description: The token ID to get the latest price for

tools.name: GET_POSITIONS
tools.description: Get the current prediction market positions held by a wallet address

walletAddress.description: The wallet address to get positions for

limit.description: Maximum number of positions to return

tools.name: GET_TRADE_HISTORY
tools.description: Get the trade history for a wallet address on Opinion.trade

walletAddress.description: The wallet address to get trade history for

limit.description: Maximum number of trades to return

tools.name: GET_QUOTE_TOKENS
tools.description: Get the list of available quote tokens (currencies) that can be used for trading on Opinion.trade
